They love to categorize and group people... to make it easy to direct their pent-up hatred against such perceived enemies. Notice that these folks are mostly fighting the ghost of their perceived enemies... since they're no open to any other info or ever change... in stark contrast with change and growth (life). They hurl those labels generously around when they detect you're not with them... then you must be against them. Accordingly there's no middle ground... and no negotiation! Finding enemies for a fanatic is easy. They thrive on fighting those 'enemies' (their own ghosts!) especially on-line. First label them... then demonstrate hatred and follow it with an attack. It's easy to distinguish the fanatic who feels very comfortable on line for being anonymous and secure to be his very real self. They love the internet for this reason. They like to tear, smear, demonize and hate. Things are only in either black or white and no 'grays' in between. Apparently that gives a high to the GOP fringe elements. Topic.Title: Anyone know what Obama's Plan is for the next 4yrs? Anyone?

Message.Msg: No new taxes on anyone earning less than 200K.. Extend the Bush tax cuts for anyone earning less than 200K taxable income and let the Bush tax cuts expire for those earning over 200K ( couples with taxable income over 250K) . Reform the tax codes. ( A tough one that everyone wants to do) Cut military spending to modify forces to better fight todays type warfare. More marines and special forces and less big ticket items like tankers and battleships. Implement Obamacare. Cut waste and fraud in Medicare and medicaid. Deport illeglas who commit crimes. Pass the dream act for illegal immigrants brought to the USA as children. Provide a course for citizenship through education or the military. Get out of Afganistan. Curtail Iranian efforts to get a Nuke. Increase cooperation with allies as he has done over the past four years. Bring manufacturing back to the USA with penalties for offshoreing and inducements to build in the USA. Continue to increase energy independence as he has for the past 4 years. Improve education for all elements of society. Better loans for college students. Pell grants for those who need more specific skills. More teachers and incentives for good teachers. Continue to improve the VA system and care for disabled Veterans. Increase cooperation and trade with Latin America that he has already started. Continue funding for planned parenthood agencies. Improve other programs that make it easier for women to work like child care and equal pay for equal work. Continue to try to get China to play fair on trade. Those are a few he has made very clear to anyone that listens. Mostly Romney claims to want to do the same things except when it comes to women, health care and increasing tax revenues. . He does also want to spend a lot more on the military thinking it will intimidate Iran in to compliance. At least that is what Ryan keeps saying. That assumes that our present military is not intimidating enough for Iran to take it seriously. Romney also throws in a few specifics like Ok the keystone pipeline as if that going to have some significant impact and lease more federal land to oil companies. thinking you believe that oil from federal land is somehow better, cheaper, or more avaiable than other oil or that just by providing leases more oil would be developed. These are just payoffs to campaign contributors. Romney also has no way to pay for all of the things he wants to increase or the taxes he wants to cut. Neither candidate has a plan that is going to balance the budget in the next 8 years. Both are hoping for much improved growth in the near future to take pressure off of the deficit and increase tax revenues.

The company was almost break-even before this gigantic news for tiny DRAM. The company has a strong balance sheet and ZERO debt. The new Radeon products will increase processing speeds by over 500% vs. conventional products. These products are initially aimed at the growing gaming industry but could be extrapolated to complex engineering simulation programs and other applications requiring super fast processing speeks DRAM could be a multi-bagger from here and it currently has no downside at today's rock-bottom prices ....DRAM NEWS Dataram to Attend AMD Radeon™ ExtravaLANza Wed, Oct 17, 2012 12:30 PM EDT PRINCETON, N.J.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Dataram Corporation (DRAM), a leading international manufacturer of computer memory, storage and software products, is proud to announce its participation at the AMD inaugural Radeon™ ExtravaLANza event on October 20, 2012 in support of the launch of AMD Radeon™ RAMDisk. The company recently announced a formal agreement with AMD to develop an AMD-branded version of its Dataram RAMDisk™, marketing the product under the name Radeon™ RAMDisk and offering gaming enthusiasts the ability to improve load times for a substantially enhanced gaming experience. Dataram representatives will be demonstrating the performance of Radeon™ RAMDisk and interacting directly with end users to answer questions and dialog about their experience with the product. Dataram will also be giving away free Radeon™ RAMDisk licenses to those end users who demonstrate the highest-performing and most creative uses of the product. The event, taking place in Markham, ON, Canada from Noon to 6:00 PM, is an opportunity to visit AMD’s Canadian headquarters and talk to some of AMD's leading global hardware and software partners. New technologies will be showcased and attendees will have an opportunity to win some great prizes. About Dataram Founded in 1967, Dataram is a worldwide leader in the manufacture of high-quality computer memory, storage and software products. Our products and services deliver IT infrastructure optimization, dramatically increase application performance and deliver substantial cost savings. Dataram solutions are deployed in 70 Fortune 100 companies and in mission-critical government and defense applications around the world. About AMD AMD (AMD) is a semiconductor design innovator leading the next era of vivid digital experiences with its groundbreaking AMD Accelerated Processing Units (APUs) that power a wide range of computing devices. AMD’s server computing products are focused on driving industry-leading cloud computing and virtualization environments. Topic.Title: WHY is BAC UP right now

Message.Msg: Bank of America (yes, Bank of America) is the best-capitalized big bank in the country. Check out the fortress balance sheet on that bank. BofA is now the best-capitalized bank with Tier 1 Capital Ratio of 8.97%--better than all of its big bank rivals. Surprised? Many are. Not long ago BofA had the worst capital levels among its big bank peers but today the bank reported a Basel III Tier 1 capital ratio of 8.97%–beating JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo and Citigroup. With an estimated Basel III capital ratio approaching 9% BofA bests JPM’s Basel III ratio of 8.4%. BofA also tops Wells Fargo’s Basel III capital ratio of 8.02% and Citigroup’s 8.6%. http://www.forbes.com/sites/halahtouryalai/2012/10/17/the-best-capitalized-bank-of-them-all-bank-of-america-not-jpmorgan/

Topic.Title: BOTH ROMNEY AND OBAMA STINK- HOLD YOUR NOSE AND VOTE FOR ONE

Message.Msg: But then, if you are registered as a member of either party, change your registration to 'independent'. Yeah, yeah, I know; in many states you will not be allowed to vote in either party's primary elections (though as a registered independent in Massachusetts, I can vote in either primary but not in both). However, regardless of the primary rules in your particular state, every voter who switches from Republican or Democrat to 'Independent' puts additional pressure on both parties to present primary candidates who appeal to a broader segment of likely voters, rather than to extreme, party-faithful loyalists and activists. Imagine the impact this would have on party fundraising, candidates, and platforms. As their identifiable base shrinks, each party faces a greater and greater conundrum: whether to go with an extreme candidate backed by a few deep-pocket donors, or put their hands out to a larger population of donors with a more centrist candidate (and platform). The current system of primaries reliably produces only two outcomes: political gridlock, or a flood of one-sided legislation and court decisions - i.e, political vendetta. No matter which side you're on, over the long haul you're all but guaranteed to get hit in the unceasing crossfire. Think of registering as an independent as 'discouraging ' their use of automatic weapons and 'limiting' the size of clips they can buy without resorting to an outright ban on either one. ROTFLMAO or just hand them two starting pistols full of blanks and tell each that the other one just said something nasty about his mom.

Message.Title: YOU SPOILED BRATS DON'T KNOW WHAT POVERTY IS-AND THAT INCLUDES BLACKS
Message.Msg: I'm 82 years old, and from ages 1-12 lived in a home (like the rest of our neighbors during the great depression), where we had no T.V., no Phone, no Automobile, rugless floors, one overhead light in each room, and a coal furnace. Our fun consisted of playing football with a rolled up newspaper tied with string, baseball with a stick and a rubber ball we stole from the playground, and hopscotch on the sidewalk. We did eat well as that was the #1 priority for our parents in their attempts to keep us healthy. There was very little meat but we had a lots of bread, pasta, and greens. Needless to say we had no fat-bellied, pasty faced zit ridden children like I see today. Most of us did very well in school, where there was no need for a Psychologist, or Social Worker, as we didn't dare to go home and tell out parents we disrespected our teachers. How come there was no need for Ritalin and other fake ways to make the kids behave? It makes my blood boil when I hear you spoiled snots say all of of the problems today are due to poverty, and you need help in conducting your lives because you don't have enough.

Message.Title: CLINTON ADMINISTRATION RESPONSIBLE FOR 9/11
Message.Msg: Bush was handed an economy heading into recession, 8 years of unfettered fomenting terrorism around the world (including the ignored 1993 attack on the World Trade Center) culminating in 9/11, a collapsing tech bubble and an energy trading meltdown crisis directly attributable to the previous years of poorly managed regulation. The difference is Bush managed the crisis and he handled the job. Obama hasn't. BTW, the only war we are not able to win is the one the Democrats were in favor of. Afghanistan! Another dose of reality, the Clinton surplus the liberals brag about came from that improperly managed tech bubble, that was allowed to careen out control. Combined with off the books borrowing from Social Security, and the neglect and failure to make appropriate expenditures to counter the increasing incidents of terror perpetrated by Al-Qaeda around the world. In other words, it never really existed except on paper. And, how do you have a surplus while you are still running up the National Debt as Clinton was? Bush, upon entering office, immediately called for investigations into Fannie and Freddie that were held up in committee or filibustered at very turn by Democrats and a handful RINOs. Bush continued to call for and urge congress to investigate these GSE’s throughout his entire presidency. No action was taken. Those investigations had the potential to expose the whole mortgage back security scam before it became critical. Thank Barney Frank, Barack Obama and Chris Dodd for leading the opposition to those requested investigations. Bush never had a super majority in congress as Obama was privileged to have for two years, and wasted on the ideological legislation of Obamacare, rather than on fixing the economy. While Obama sat on his hands waiting for Harry Reid and Nancy Pelosi to push though his health care nightmare, the economy continued to fall deeper and deeper into despair. Spending reeled out of control with government sinking it’s tentacles deep into the private sector arena with business choking regulations and bailouts for campaign donors of Obama. Had Obama put aside his ideological nonsense and focused on a private sector based recovery plan we would not still be in this dire recession. This is Obama's mess, in all this time as president he and his party still refuse to take responsibility, and he continues to blame everything under the sun but himself. Yet Democrats blame Bush for everything that transpired in his first nine months. Double standard idiocy! Obama is no leader! Obama is without one original cogent idea! Obama has damage hundreds of thousands of families beyond repair. He's just a sniveling whiner! And now he wants to sue the banks! What a feeble ideologically blinded mind this president has! The fact that the Clinton staff vandalized the White House and government computers and offices, and dumped and scrambled files, before leaving tells you the juvenile mind set of that administration. And Bill Clinton used the full power of the oval office and the presidency to pressure a young fat intern into being his human humidor at the expense of the entire country. A despicable self-absorbed old pervert by any measure. I have no respect for this man nor anyone who does.

Topic.Title: Beware of Republican election fraud.

Message.Msg: Who would have thought the Republican attempt to block voting would only catch Republicans in the net!!! TOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO FUNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNY!!! 10/19/2012 A campaign worker linked to a controversial Republican consulting firm has been arrested in Virginia and charged with throwing voter registration forms into a dumpster. The suspect, Colin Small, 31, was described by a local law enforcement official as a "supervisor" in a Republican Party financed operation to register voters in Rockingham County in rural Virginia, a key swing state in the Nov. 6 election. He was arrested after a local business owner in the same Harrisonburg, Va., shopping center where the local GOP campaign headquarters is located spotted Small tossing a bag into the trash, according to a statement Thursday by the Rockingham County Sheriff’s office. The bag was later found to contain eight voter registration forms, it said. The arrest was reported Thursday night by WWBT-TV in Richmond.
